summary:
Ageing fine: 10 healthy meal planning tips for better health, nutrition

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Moneycontrol

This article provides ten essential meal planning tips to help individuals maintain better health and nutrition as they age.

  • Enjoy diverse foods to minimise disease risks like diabetes and hypertension with colourful fruits and vegetables.
  • Prioritise protein-rich foods to maintain muscle strength.
  • Include fruits and vegetables in meals and snacks for fiber and vitamins.
  • Ensure adequate B12 intake through fortified foods or supplements.
  • Season meals with herbs and citrus instead of salt to reduce sodium.
  • Opt for unsaturated fats like olive oil or avocados over saturated fats.
  • Stay hydrated to support digestion and nutrient absorption.
  • Choose whole grains for sustained energy and fiber.
  • Include calcium-rich foods like dairy or fortified non-dairy products.
  • Maintain appropriate portion sizes to manage calorie intake.

Ozone Therapy Promise for Sepsis-Induced Lung Injury: Researchers - The Sentinel Assam
summary:
Ozone Therapy Promise for Sepsis-Induced Lung Injury: Researchers

Publication Date: Not specified in the article Source: Sentinel Assam

Researchers at Nanjing Medical University report that medical ozone therapy is a promising treatment for sepsis-induced acute lung injury (ALI), which could significantly improve survival rates and lung function. This therapy targets neutrophil extracellular traps (NETs) that exacerbate lung injury.

  • Sepsis is a leading cause of ALI and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
  • The study published in the Journal of Biomedical Research indicates ozone therapy effectively clears NETs in mice models.
  • The research suggests ozone therapy could dramatically improve outcomes in critical care for sepsis patients.
  • If validated in human trials, ozone therapy could become a viable treatment for sepsis-induced lung injury.
"Our research demonstrates that medical ozone therapy could dramatically improve the management of sepsis-induced ALI," said Dr. Wen-Tao Liu, principal investigator.

This study represents an important step towards developing effective treatments for sepsis, potentially transforming patient care and survival rates.
newTitle: Ozone Therapy Promise for Sepsis-Induced Lung Injury: Researchers

title: Explained: Bird flu could be 2025's biggest health problems - NewsBytes
summary:
Explained: Bird flu could be 2025's biggest health problem

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: NewsBytes

As 2025 draws closer, global health experts are becoming increasingly alarmed by the rapid transmission of bird flu, particularly with a notable rise in cases in the United States.

  • The H5N1 strain has jumped from birds to other animals and humans.
  • Reported human mortality rate stands at 30% for bird flu infections.
  • Potential for a single mutation could enable human-to-human transmission.
  • Governments are preparing pandemic plans, including vaccine stockpiling.
  • Concerns exist regarding its impact on animal health and food supply chains.
"The situation highlights the importance of the 'one health' approach, which considers human, animal, and environmental health as interconnected entities."

The emergence and potential spread of H5N1 emphasize the need for vigilance and preparedness as we approach 2025, with significant consequences for both human and animal health.

Low Sperm Count? 5 Proven Lifestyle Changes and Fertility Solutions for Oligospermia - TheHealthSite
summary:
Men's Sexual Health Problems: Low Sperm Count? 5 Proven Lifestyle Changes and Fertility Solutions for Oligospermia

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Health Site

Understanding and tackling low sperm count, known as oligospermia, is essential for those looking to conceive. The article outlines lifestyle changes and medical approaches to improve fertility.

Key Points:

  • Nutrition: Increase intake of zinc, folate, and omega-3 fatty acids.
  • Exercise and Stress Management: Engage in regular physical activity and stress-reducing practices like yoga.
  • Sleep: Aim for 7-9 hours of quality sleep to help regulate hormones.
  • Weight Management: Maintain a healthy weight to support sperm health.
  • Avoid Smoking and Alcohol: Both are detrimental to sperm motility and counts.
  • Heat Exposure: Minimize exposure to heat on the groin area.
  • Chemical Exposures: Limit contact with harmful chemicals.
  • Medical Treatments: Explore options like IUI and ICSI if lifestyle changes are insufficient.

Notable Quotes:

“Low sperm count does not have to be the definition of your journey to parenthood.”

Conclusion:

With mindful lifestyle changes and medical support, achieving parenthood is an attainable goal for men facing fertility challenges.
newTitle: Men's Sexual Health: 5 Proven Ways to Address Low Sperm Count

title: Bilateral primary vitreoretinal lymphoma masquerading as fungal endophthalmitis- a case report - Journal of Ophthalmic Inflammation and Infection
summary:
Bilateral Primary Vitreoretinal Lymphoma Masquerading as Fungal Endophthalmitis - A Case Report

Published: 30 December 2024 | Source: Journal of Ophthalmic Inflammation and Infection, Volume 14, Article number 69

This article reports a case of bilateral primary vitreoretinal lymphoma (PVRL) that was initially suspected to be an infectious endophthalmitis in a patient with recent cataract surgery and COVID-19 history. The diagnosis was eventually confirmed through multimodal imaging and a sub retinal biopsy.

  • A 60-year-old male patient presented with vision loss post cataract surgery.
  • Clinical suspicion of endophthalmitis led to diagnostic vitrectomy, which returned negative microbiological results.
  • Multimodal imaging and biopsy confirmed PVRL, which was treated with intravitreal methotrexate.
  • Patient achieved remission after multiple injections.
“Vitritis with sub-RPE yellowish deposits may be mistaken for infectious endophthalmitis, especially in a patient with a history of intraocular surgery or immunosuppression.”

This case emphasizes the importance of considering PVRL in differential diagnosis, especially for middle-aged patients presenting with similar symptoms, highlighting how critical timely diagnosis and appropriate management can be for patient outcomes.
newTitle: Bilateral Primary Vitreoretinal Lymphoma Misdiagnosed as Fungal Endophthalmitis: A Case Report

Malaysian diabetics face medicine shortage as slimming craze thins supply of Ozempic - asianews.network
summary:
Ozempic Shortage in Malaysia: Slimming Craze Impacts Diabetics

Date & Source: December 30, 2024, PETALING JAYA

Malaysian Pharmacists Society president Amrahi Buang confirmed the shortage of Ozempic, a diabetes medication that has gained popularity as a weight-loss solution. The increased demand from non-diabetic individuals has led to a scarcity, impacting those who genuinely need the drug to manage their diabetes.

  1. Ozempic, a semaglutide injectable medication, helps manage blood sugar levels in adults with Type 2 diabetes.
  2. Pharmacists warn against misusing the drug for weight loss without medical supervision due to potential side effects like hypoglycemia.
  3. Distributors have started rationing supplies to ensure broader access.
  4. Side effects include nausea, diarrhoea, constipation, and vomiting, with potential long-term effects like gallbladder issues.
  5. Semaglutide should be used alongside lifestyle and dietary changes, with serious complications like pancreatitis being rare.
“There are many who are interested only in the drug’s weight loss potency, creating a huge demand and a shortage in the market.” – Amrahi Buang, Malaysian Pharmacists Society president

Conclusion: The global weight loss craze around Ozempic has led to a shortage in Malaysia, impacting diabetics who rely on the medication to manage their blood sugar levels. Pharmacists and medical professionals warn against misusing the drug without proper medical guidance.
newTitle: Ozempic Shortage in Malaysia: Slimming Craze Impacts Diabetics

title: CDC Detects Bird Flu Mutation in Human, Amid New Infections in Cats - ScienceAlert
summary:
CDC Detects Bird Flu Mutation in Human, Amid New Infections in Cats

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Agence France-Presse

The ongoing spread of bird flu in the United States has alarmed experts, especially with new infections reported in cats and a potential mutation of the virus in humans.

  • A sample from a critically ill patient in Louisiana shows signs of mutation that may enhance the virus's ability to infect humans.
  • The CDC reported 65 confirmed human cases of bird flu in 2024, with more potentially undetected.
  • An infected cat in Oregon died from contaminated raw pet food, raising concerns over transmission risks to humans.
  • The mutation in the human virus is believed to have occurred during replication in the ill patient, with no evidence of wider human transmission.
  • Experts caution that while mutations can help virus binding, they do not necessarily indicate increased transmissibility or severity.
"It's good to know we should be looking out for this, but it doesn't actually tell us, 'Oh, we're this much closer to a pandemic now.'" — Dr. Angela Rasmussen

Researchers are also monitoring infections in cats, as this could pose a risk for human transmission. Prompt attention is necessary to understand the implications of these developments.
newTitle: CDC Detects Bird Flu Mutation in Human, Amid New Infections in Cats

summary:
Vaccines to be Available Every Wednesday at Wellness Centres in Tamil Nadu

Date: Recent
Source: Directorate of Public Health and Preventive Medicine

The Directorate of Public Health has mandated that all Health and Wellness Centres in Tamil Nadu will offer vaccines every Wednesday, aiming to enhance immunisation services in urban regions.

  • Vaccines provided under the Universal Immunization Programme cover 12 Vaccine Preventable Diseases.
  • Annually, approximately 9.57 lakh pregnant women and 8.77 lakh children are immunised through this initiative.
  • There are 2,712 Cold Chain Points across the state to store vaccines.
  • Immunisation is part of a comprehensive service package provided at these centres.
  • The initiative aims to address gaps in vaccine coverage in urban areas.
“A shortfall of routine immunisation doses has been observed against the targeted number.”

To enhance routine immunisation and combat vaccine-preventable diseases, all district health officers are directed to integrate 708 HWCs into their immunisation plans.

Ozone therapy promising new treatment for sepsis-induced lung injury: Study - Nagaland Post
summary:
Ozone therapy promising new treatment for sepsis-induced lung injury: Study

Publication Date: [Insert publication date here] | Source: Nagaland Post

This study from Nanjing Medical University highlights ozone therapy as a hopeful new treatment for sepsis-induced acute lung injury (ALI).

  • Sepsis is a severe complication of infection and a leading cause of ALI and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
  • Medical ozone therapy showed potential to improve survival rates in preclinical models of sepsis-induced ALI.
  • Neutrophil extracellular traps (NETs), which trap pathogens, can also trigger inflammation, worsening lung injury.
  • The study discusses the mechanisms by which ozone therapy clears NETs and improves lung function.
  • Dr. Wen-Tao Liu noted that this therapy could lead to better outcomes for sepsis patients.
  • If validated in human trials, ozone therapy may become a significant treatment option.
  • The advancement of this therapy could reshape the management of sepsis, offering new hope for those affected.
“Our research demonstrates that medical ozone therapy could dramatically improve the management of sepsis-induced ALI.” - Dr. Wen-Tao Liu

This research marks a critical step in exploring innovative treatments for sepsis, aiming to enhance patient care in critical settings.
newTitle: Ozone Therapy Shows Promise as a Treatment for Sepsis-Induced Lung Injury

title: Who Is Leana Wen? Health Expert Slammed For Advocating Immediate H5N1 Vaccine Approval - Times Now
summary:
Who Is Leana Wen? Health Expert Advocates for Quick H5N1 Vaccine Approval

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Times Now

Dr. Leana Wen, a prominent public health figure, urges the Biden administration to expedite the approval and rollout of H5N1 bird flu vaccines amidst growing concerns about potential outbreaks.

  • Wen emphasizes the availability of an H5N1 vaccine, noting that the administration has contracted for nearly 5 million doses.
  • She highlights the need for rapid testing for farm workers and their families to identify potential viral risks.
  • Wen expresses worries about policy shifts under a new administration and advocates for transparency in reporting bird flu cases.
  • Advises that caution against the consequences of delayed vaccine authorization could mirror early COVID-19 challenges.
This is not like the early days of COVID. We have a vaccine for H5N1. The Biden administration has already contracted for nearly 5 million doses.

In conclusion, Dr. Wen calls for immediate action to prevent potential health crises, stressing the importance of being prepared and proactive in healthcare strategies.
newTitle: Who Is Leana Wen? Health Expert Advocates for Quick H5N1 Vaccine Approval
